job_title: Student Library Assistant in Great Barrington, MA
pros: You learn how to deal with people.
cons: There aren't really any cons apart from some town visitors who may be difficult to deal with.

job_title: Community Director in Great Barrington, MA
pros: Other community directors were pleasant to work with.
cons: Seemingly no concrete policies. Hardly any supervision. Completing similar duties as I did as an RA during undergrad. Extremely unprofessional work environment. I was never told what my role was or what exactly I should be doing.
Not a lot of professional growth opportunities

job_title: Resident Director in Great Barrington, MA
pros: Small, apartments, community, rural, no traffic
cons: Leadership, support, work/life balance, pay, mobility, no student staff, no structure for Residential Life

job_title: Student Worker in Great Barrington, MA
pros: Getting paid, meeting interesting people, making food sometimes
cons: Long and inconvenient hours, late nights. standing for hours

review_title: Enjoyed the job, my supervisors and team, and the school community
pros: Close to home, great interaction with the complete campus community, got to stretch my wings within the department, small and beautiful campus, could work remotely. Opportunity to enjoy performances and events, but students and outside performers on campus.
cons: The physical campus needs better lighting, more even roads and walkways, and better signage. Processes weren’t always efficient and priorities not always defined. Staff was an integral part of campus, but often felt like we were secondary to faculty and students.

job_title: Communications Director in Great Barrington, MA
pros:
Salary
Benefits
Ample room for advancement 
Singular mission, very interesting as an institution
College leadership really cares about staff and mission
cons:
Some offices and buildings are beautiful and others feel like a prison
Many couples on staff: it can feel especially small and incestuous 
The college is very slow to change
Some departments were very difficult to work with and created unnecessary road blocks

review_title: Great Place to work, excellent people and work environment
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Great Barrington, MA
pros: Flexible work schedule, great atmosphere with dedicated staff and faculty. Great students as well.
cons: Pay is below industry averages, can create a financial strain.

pros:
Easy to obtain a job as a student.
Usually many students around to tutor in order to make more money.
Get paid on time.
cons: Wage isn't too high, but enough to get by as a student.

review_title: People pretend to care about you but actually do not.
job_title: Student Representative in Great Barrington, MA
pros: The fact that they pretend to care about you means you have some extra leeway.
cons: The fact that they're pretending means that they don't really care about what happens to you or how they make you feel.

job_title: Residence Director in Great Barrington, MA
pros: Small, tight knit community. Students are wonderful
cons: Small liberal arts school that struggles with being financially stable. Don't pay their Campus Life Staff accordingly.

review_title: A caring location, for a broken person...
pros: They cared. A lot. It was nice
cons: I didn't. A lot. It was hard.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Great Barrington, MA
